channel.title: Quantitative Finance - Playlist (Youtube)
channel.description: Playlist with industry insights into the world of quantitative finance.

item.title: Skills Needed To Succeed As A Quant - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: What does someone in quantitative finance do, what skills do you need to be successful?

item.title: Quantitative Researcher Interviews - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: What do Quantitative Researchers look for in candidates?

item.title: Quant Research At A Hedge Fund Vs. Other Tech Careers - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: What is quantitative research like at a hedge fund? How does it differ from other tech careers?

item.title: Andrew, Citadel Quant Finance Careers and Olympic Athlete- with Kaushik and Nick, Elevate Career Network
item.link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u3Q-k5LGvwA If you've ever been interested or curious about quant finance - which is the the next frontier of finance, one of the hottest and most competitive areas in investing, at the nexus of top finance and technology, this is the discussion for you. Even if you haven't thought about it yet, you will still find it fascinating.

item.title: Skillset Needed To Be A Successful Quant - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: What skills over the next 3-5 years should people look to build to be successful in quant?

item.title: Why Citadel Is A Great Firm For Quants - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: What is it like working at Citadel? Why would you want to work there as a quant?

item.title: Citadel Quant Researcher on The Reward and Feedback Cycle
item.description: Citadel Quant Researcher on the reward and feedback cycle in quant investing, and working at the nexus of finance and technology.

item.title: Training For Olympics While Working As A Quant - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: Work-life balance; training for Olympic rowing while working as a quant.

item.title: Similarities Between Careers And Athletics - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: How quants look for an edge in their jobs, is it similar to how athletes look for an edge in their sports?

item.title: How To Know If Quantitative Research Is Career For You - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: How will you know if quantitative research is a career path for you?

item.title: Biggest Difference Maker in Your Career | Elevate and Citadel Quant
item.description: Citadel Quant, Andrew, on what he thinks is a huge difference maker and what's helped him throughout his career. When faced with challenging problems, resist the urge to ask for help right away - but rather be fearless enough to figure it out on your own.

item.title: Advice To Young Professionals In Competitive Industries - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: Career advice to young professionals in competitive industries.

item.title: Book Recommendations - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: Favorite Books: The Man Who Solved The Market, Flash Boys, and the author Murakami.

item.title: Misconceptions About Technology Careers - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: The biggest misconceptions about careers in technology.

item.title: Similarities Between Teamwork In Athletics And Careers - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: How teamwork on a sports team teaches empathy that can be applied when working on a team in your career.

item.title: Recommended News Sources - Andrew, Quantitative Researcher at Citadel
item.description: Favorite daily news publications.

item.title: Webinar | My Interview Experience at D.E. Shaw
item.description: Tune into this webinar to hear Prajjwal Jha talk about his SDE internship interview experience at D.E. Shaw, a multinational investment management firm.

item.title: D.E. Shaw and Co. Interview Preparation Strategies
item.description: Watch Atmadeep Chanda, an Associate Developer at D.E. Shaw and Co. discuss the tips and strategies required to ace the interview process.

item.title: Capacity to ship packages within D days | Recently asked in DE Shaw
item.description: Sometimes the interviewer wants to check that can you utilize the concepts you have learned and extend them to solve another problem. Such a concept is Binary Search and the problem we are discussing here is a very good example of that.

item.title: Count of substrings with exactly K distinct characters | Recently asked in DE Shaw
item.description: A hard question that can be asked to check your concepts and how do you manipulate string. Including a very famous and popular algorithm asked in interviews.

item.title: Cold E-mailing (The Best Skill to Get a Job)
item.description: Cold e-mailing is by FAR the most important skill if you don't have a job. If you're at a non-target or have no finance experience, you NEED to play the numbers game and reach out to tons of people in order to get any interviews. I reached out to 300+ people to get my first paid internship as a sophomore.

item.title: What do Firms / Headhunters Really Care About?
item.description: Finance firms and headhunters are ultimately looking for hard working and smart candidates that they can get along with. Hiring is a very difficult process even for firms, so they often rely on several external markers when making this decision. I find that your firm and your school still matter the most when it comes to getting interviews.

item.title: Guide to Coffee Chats (Informational Interviews)
item.description: The coffee chat is one of the most important skills in networking. A huge part of breaking into investment banking is doing coffee chats with people at every firm. In order to make a good impression, you need to ask detailed, thoughtful questions that communicate your interest in the firm. By asking the right questions, you can also learn a lot of recruiting intel via coffee chats.

item.title: The data science resume that got me my FAANG job (entry level data scientist)
item.description: In this video, I go through the resume that got me into FAANG as a data scientist. The resume is the key to getting that interview, which is definitely the hardest part of the entire application process for a data scientist. Our role is super popular but actual positions few and far between. That's why I spent A LOT of time on this resume to get my foot in the door. We're going to go through this line by line and item by item as I go into the details and roast it hard. Sit back and enjoy! :)

item.title: Self taught software developer resume (several job offers)
item.description: Learn how to write your resume and break into SWE in under 20 minutes. In this video I review my previous resume, the one I sent out to several employers in my job search. This resume helped me land several tech offers in my fields of interest. Hopefully by reviewing my previous resume with me you can learn how to structure your resume as you transition from school, a bootcamp, or your own bedroom into a software developer role.

item.title: Why you should have a portfolio website
item.description: Hi friends! In this video, I talk about what a portfolio is, explain who benefits the most from having one, and go in depth about how to structure one and what to put in it.

item.title: Quant trading behavioral interview
item.description: In this video I share a segment of a one-on-one private consulting session I had with a client of mine (with his consent). This session was focused on the behavioral interview that most candidates will get with HR (as a screening interview) before they are pushed to the technical interview round. In the segment I provide the interviewee with tangible advice to better their behavioral interview performance.

item.title: Challengers Wanted for Quantitative Research Careers
item.description: As a Quantitative Researcher at Citadel Securities, not only will you be challenged to come up with innovative ideas and strategies, you’ll see the real-world impact of your work from day one and beyond.

item.title: Finding a job as a Quantitative Researcher (Quant) and HFT on linkedin
item.description: How to find a high frequency trading job and quantitative research (quant) job on linkedin.

item.title: Overview, Review and Study Tips - Google Data Analytics Professional Certificate
item.description: Live session where we'll go over the Google Data Analytics Professional Certificate. I'll give you my thoughts on the certificate (spoiler alert: I think this is such a great program) but I'll go into specifics on why it's such a great program and give you my tips on how to get the most out of this program and set yourself up for success so you don't just give up after a month :P

item.title: Real Data Science SQL Interview Questions and Answers # 1 | Data Science Interview Questions
item.description: You may notice that I literally talk through every single thing that I'm doing. This is what interviewers are looking for. This way, the interviewer can clearly understand the approach you're taking and exactly what you're doing. It's crucial because if you do something wrong, the interviewer can actually step in and steer you in the right direction. It's also more conversational and way less awkward than you sitting in silence writing your query lol.

item.title: QL Data Science Interview Questions and Answers (interview style walk-through) | SQL Sundays #4
item.description: You may notice that I literally talk through every single thing that I'm doing. This is what interviewers are looking for. This way, the interviewer can clearly understand the approach you're taking and exactly what you're doing. It's crucial because if you do something wrong, the interviewer can actually step in and steer you in the right direction. It's also more conversational and way less awkward than you sitting in silence writing your query lol.

item.title: SQL Data Science Interview Questions and Answers (interview style walk-through) | Question 3
item.description: This is another data science SQL interview question done from beginning to end in real interview style. I'm also introducing StrataScratch, a platform with curated real SQL interview questions (and python), dummy data, and solutions. Be sure to stay until the end of the video to get more information about the platform as well as my honest review of the pros and cons of the platform.

item.title: Real Data Science SQL Interview Questions and Answers # 2 | Data Science Interview Questions
item.description: This is another data science SQL interview question done from beginning to end in real interview style. This question features "Case When", "Group By", and "Count" aggregation.

item.title: Data Science SQL Interview Question Walkthrough | SQL Sundays #5
item.link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BADhEALNVUA This is another data science SQL interview question and answer done from beginning to end in real interview style.

item.title: SQL Data Science Interview Question Walkthrough | SQL Sundays #6
item.description: This is another data science SQL interview question and answer done from beginning to end in real interview style.

item.title: Data Science SQL Interview Question Walkthrough (real interview style) | SQL Sundays #7
item.description: This is another data science SQL interview question and answer done from beginning to end in real interview style.

item.title: Data Science SQL Interview Question Walkthrough (real interview style) | SQL Sundays #8
item.description: This is another data science SQL interview question and answer done from beginning to end in real interview style.

item.title: Data Science SQL Interview Question Walkthrough | SQL Sundays #9
item.description: Hi friends! Here's a SQL Sunday as part of the SQL Sundays series in celebration of the launch of my SQL for tech and data science interviews course! I know I know it's Tuesday :x Can we let this one slide?

item.title: The quant trader interview guide
item.description: In this video, I invited back Worthan Kwan, our favourite quant trader! Worthan explains step by step the quant trading interview process and the resources he used to prepare for his interviews - including an in depth explanation on how to do well in the mock trading that is usually in final round and messes up a lot of people.

item.title: Interview with a quant trader
item.description: This is an extremely lucrative but pretty mysterious job that I know many people are interested in learning more about. In this video, I interview Worthan Kwan, a quant trader at a hedge fund to learn about his day to day, how much money people are really making, what the requirements are to become a quant trader, and much more! I also made a post a few weeks back crowdsourcing questions and I'm pretty proud to say that we got through almost all of them in this video :D

item.title: How to Become a Quant at Alameda Research
item.description: Sam Bankman-Fried, the CEO of FTX, explained what a quantitative analyst is, how to become a quant, and quant trader skills. He also went through what to expect from a quant trader career. Becoming a good quantitative researcher requires a lot of hands-on training.

item.title: Quant Researcher at Morgan Stanley | How to get into Quant and Market Risk Profile at Investment Banks
item.description: Get real insights about the life of a Quantitative Researcher at Morgan Stanley straight from Mukesh Kumar, who got into Quant Researcher - Market Risk role after pursuing MBA.

item.title: Is your resume good enough for quant anything?
item.description: Quant industry resume building advice and live resume review.

item.title: The software engineering resume that got me into FAANG and Goldman Sachs (internship)
item.description: This is my software engineering resume that got me internship offers from goldman sachs and amazon. Looking back now, this resume really isn't the best but despite how hard I roast it, it still is the resume that got me my internship offers :) Enjoy!

item.title: Quantitative Trading: 7.5k Sell Wall of Bitcoin on Binance
item.description: In this episode, the CEO of FTX and Alameda shows you his quantitative trading strategy and is focused on trading Bitcoin (BTC). During this quant trading interview, Sam Bankman-Fried admits their biggest trading obstacle for the day was not having enough Tether on Binance to buy up the Bitcoin (BTC). If you enjoyed this crypto quant live trading session, please subscribe to the FTX channel.

item.title: Quants | The Alchemists of Wall Street | VPRO documentary
item.description: Quants are the math wizards and computer programmers in the engine room of our global financial system who designed the financial products that almost crashed Wall street. The credit crunch has shown how the global financial system has become increasingly dependent on mathematical models trying to quantify human (economic) behaviour. Now the quants are at the heart of yet another technological revolution in finance: trading at the speed of light.

item.title: Flash Crash 2010 | VPRO documentary | 2011
item.description: Money and Speed: Inside the Black Box is a thriller based on actual events that takes you to the heart of our automated world. Based on interviews with those directly involved and data visualizations up to the millisecond, it reconstructs the flash crash of May 6th 2010: the fastest and deepest U.S. stock market plunge ever.

item.title: Is the world going quants mad? Dr Paul Wilmott
item.description: Keynote Speaker Dr Paul Wilmott discusses:"Imagination is more important than knowledge: street smarts vs book learning in financial markets."

item.title: WECode 2016 Lightning Talk with Ellen Zhong (DE Shaw Research)
item.description: WECode (Women Engineers Code) is the largest student-run Women in Computer Science conference, held at Harvard University each February. Our mission is to expand the skills, network, and community of technical women worldwide. We bring together women over the course of two amazing days to share ideas and conversations on technology and innovation.

item.title: Who are Quant Developers (and why they make so much)? | Quantitative Finance
item.description: In this video you will learn about the job profile of the quantitative developers.

item.title: Upcoming Quant Star - Ali Masoumnia Interview
item.description: I interview Ali Masoumnia all about running a successful quantitative finance club at a university, how to approach professionals, the advantages of target schools, and are standards important in quant finance as well as life.

item.title: Quant trading and research question and answers
item.description: Nearly 2 hour video Quant trading and research question and answer pow wow Aug 8. This was really good where we cover general economy, covered options trading, machine learning/math, best programming languages, etc.

item.title: Become a Quant: Data Science and Trading
Public Lecture 1 : James H. Simons - My Life in Mathematics
item.description: Seoul ICM 2014 Public Lecture.

item.title: Jim Simons: Life Lessons from the ‘World’s Smartest Billionaire'
item.description: Mathematician, code breaker, Professor, hedge fund pioneer, and philanthropist Jim Simons makes his first-ever podcast appearance on this episode of INTO THE IMPOSSIBLE. Learn about Chern-Simons theory, leadership lessons, hedge funds, and a dedication to serve the world through basic research.

item.title: The mathematician who cracked Wall Street | Jim Simons
item.description: Jim Simons was a mathematician and cryptographer who realized: the complex math he used to break codes could help explain patterns in the world of finance. Billions later, he’s working to support the next generation of math teachers and scholars. TED’s Chris Anderson sits down with Simons to talk about his extraordinary life in numbers.

item.title: Can he break into quant trading?
item.description: This is a video of a 1-on-1 private consulting session I had with an aspiring quantitative researcher. I start by introducing you to his background before giving him advice as to how to break into the industry. He comes from a physics background (masters in theoretical physics) and is looking to beef up his CV with quant research-related projects. Furthermore, he's looking for resources for more advances topics such as probability, data analysis, and option trading. Lastly, we talk about how he can level up his python skills so he can differentiate himself as a passionate candidate.

item.title: Into the Mind of a SWE Intern @ Jane Street | Interview with Omkar Kulkarni
item.description: In this video, I interview my roommate who interned at Jump Trading Summer 2020 and will be interning with Jane Street Summer 2021. He has received offers from Jump Trading, Jane Street, Two Sigma, and Akuna Capital for both SWE and Quant Trading internships. Throughout the interview, I ask him to talk about his computer science journey since high school and how his interests have changed to land him in the quant space.

item.title: Trading Secrets from a Jane Street Veteran - Craig Newbold Interview
item.description: We discuss what skills retail traders should be developing to compete in the 21st century markets, the pros and cons of different approaches, trading stories, the path to professional trading, and different sources of alpha that retail traders should explore.

item.title: The Wall Street Code | VPRO documentary | 2013
item.description: A thriller about a genius algorithm builder who dared to stand up against Wall Street. Haim Bodek, aka The Algo Arms Dealer. After Quants: the Alchemists of Wall Street and Money and Speed: Inside the Black Box. This is the final episode of a trilogy in search of the winners and losers of the tech revolution on Wall Street. Trading on the financial market is not longer dominated by humans, but by super fast computers and algorithms. The result of this digital revolution on Wall Street is a complex and fragmented financial system that is hard to understand and overseen. A system that we are all connected to. The only people who understand the system a bit, are the people who built it.
